intro: Chaetothylopsis, commonly known as the spiny leaf orchid, is a genus of flowering plants in the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South and Southeast Asia, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plants are characterized by their unique, spiny leaves and showy, often fragrant flowers. Chaetothylopsis species typically grow as epiphytes or terrestrial plants, depending on the species. Their botanical significance lies in their ecological role and their value in horticultural collections.
